jodd.inex

Class InExRules<V,D,R>

  • java.lang.Object
    • jodd.inex.InExRules<V,D,R>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    InExRuleMatcher<V,R>

    public class InExRules<V,D,R>
extends java.lang.Object
implements InExRuleMatcher<V,R>
    A single-class rule engine for includes/excludes filtering logic. It can be used when set of objects has to filtered using includes and excludes rules. For example, when filtering files by file name etc.

    Rule engine works in one of two modes:

    • blacklist - when any input is allowed by default and when you specify explicit excludes.
    • whitelist - when any input is disabled by default and when you specify explicit includes.

    The logic of this rule engine depends on the current mode. In both cases, always the inverse rules are considered first. For example, for blacklist mode, engine first examine excludes, and then includes. This way you can set any filter combination.

    All Jodd classes that filters something uses this class to unify the behavior across the Jodd library.

    About generics: rule engine examine Values (V). Rules are defined as Definitions (D). They are stored internally as R, that is used with Values.

      • detectMode

        public void detectMode()
        Sets blacklist or whitelist mode depending on rules. Smart mode determines the following:
        • If there are only include rules, then the whitelist mode is set.
        • If there are only excluded rules, then the blacklist mode is set.
        • In any other case (both type of rules exist or no rules are set), then mode is not changed.
        Should be called after all the rules are set, before matching starts.

      • include

        public void include(D rule)
        Adds include rule.

        Adds exclude rule.

      • apply

        public boolean apply(V value,
                     boolean flag)
        Applies rules on given flag using current black/white list mode.
        See Also:
        apply(Object, boolean, boolean)

      • apply

        public boolean apply(V value,
                     boolean blacklist,
                     boolean flag)
        Applies rules on given flag. Flag is only changed if at least one rule matched. Otherwise, the same value is returned. This way you can chain several rules and have the rule engine change the flag only when a rule is matched.
